seriesJson.title: American language
seriesJson.description: A series of talks by Mitford Mathews, editor of the Dictionary of Americanisms and lecturer in linguistics at the University of Chicago.

node.title: More from the Dutch
node.description: The fifth program in this series continues to discuss the influence of Dutch upon American English.

node.title: The colonists go a-borrowing
node.description: The second program in this series, "The Colonists Go A-Borrowing," talks about the influence of Native Americans on colonists' language usage.

node.title: Imported from France
node.description: The seventh program in this series discusses the influence of French upon American English.

node.title: Further borrowing from the Indians
node.description: The third program in this series, "Further Borrowing from the Indians," continues to explore the influence that Native Americans had on the way colonists spoke English.

subject.name: English language--United States--Foreign words and phrases--Indian.

node.title: The Spanish gift
node.description: The eighth program in this series discusses the influence of Spanish upon American English.

node.title: Americans as makers of words
node.description: The first program in this series talks about "Americans as Makers of Words."

node.title: A German contribution
node.description: The sixth program in this series discusses the influence of German upon American English.

node.title: A word from the Dutch
node.description: The fourth program in this series discusses  the influence of Dutch upon American English.

node.title: Words from all over
node.description: The final program in this series discusses the influence of various languages, like Eskimo and Chinook, upon American English.
